perturbation.original_text: 1.6 "CUSTOMER(S)" means one or more customers of the Corio Services having its principal executive offices in North America who obtains a sublicense from Corio to use the Software by accessing one or more Corio Servers.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.6 "CUSTOMER(S)" means any entity worldwide, regardless of its principal executive offices location, that expresses interest in the Corio Services and potentially uses the Software, whether through a sublicense or trial access.
perturbation.explanation: Original text restricts customers to those with principal offices in North America. The modified text broadens the definition to any entity worldwide expressing interest, creating a contradiction on customer eligibility criteria.

perturbation.original_text: 2.1 HOSTING SOFTWARE LICENSE. Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, Changepoint hereby grants to Corio a fee-bearing, irrevocable, nonexclusive, nontransferable (except in accordance with Section 14.1 of this Agreement) license in the Territory to (i) reproduce the Software in machine executable object code format only for installation on the Corio Servers; (ii) install multiple copies of the Software on Corio's Servers which will be made remotely accessible to Corio's Customers for their internal business purposes, (iii) permit limited access to and use of the Software by Customers through Corio Servers solely for such Customer's internal business purposes; (iv) sublicense an unlimited number of Customers to access and use the Software only through the installation on Corio Servers solely for such Customer's internal business purposes; and (v) use Changepoint's tools and utilities, if any, subject to any restrictions placed on the Changepoint by third party software providers and payment of any applicable fees required by such third parties, to configure, integrate and manage the Software. Corio shall not authorize Customers to download or reproduce the Software for use except as necessary in connection with the Corio Services. Except as specifically authorized by this Agreement, no license is granted under this Agreement to Corio to distribute the Software to its Customers or for use other than as part of the Corio Services.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.1 HOSTING SOFTWARE LICENSE. Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, Changepoint hereby grants to Corio a fee-bearing, revocable, nonexclusive, nontransferable (except in accordance with Section 14.1 of this Agreement) license in the Territory to (i) reproduce the Software in machine executable object code format only for installation on the Corio Servers; (ii) install a limited number of copies of the Software on Corio's Servers which will be made remotely accessible to Corio's Customers for their internal business purposes, (iii) permit broad access to and unrestricted use of the Software by Customers through Corio Servers for any Customer purposes; (iv) sublicense a limited number of Customers to access and use the Software through the installation on Corio Servers solely for such Customer's internal business purposes; and (v) use Changepoint's tools and utilities, if any, subject to any restrictions placed on the Changepoint by third party software providers and payment of any applicable fees required by such third parties, to configure, integrate and manage the Software. Corio may authorize Customers to download and reproduce the Software for use as they see fit in connection with or separate from the Corio Services. Except as specifically restricted by this Agreement, a license is granted under this Agreement to Corio to distribute the Software to its Customers or for use other than as part of the Corio Services.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states the license is 'irrevocable', the number of copies of software to be installed is 'multiple', limits access for customer's internal business purposes, and sublicenses an 'unlimited number of customers' for access to the Software. The modified version contradicts the 'irrevocable' nature by changing it to 'revocable', the number of copies of software to be installed to 'a limited number', permits 'broad access to and unrestricted use of the Software by Customers for any Customer purposes', and sublicenses a 'limited number of customers' for access to the Software. This creates uncertainty about license rights.

perturbation.original_text: 4.4 AUDIT RIGHTS. Corio shall keep true and accurate books of accounts and records for determining the amounts payable to Changepoint under this Agreement. Such books and records shall be kept for at least three (3) years following the end of the calendar month to which they pertain, and shall be open for inspection by an independent certified public accountant reasonably acceptable to Corio, and made subject to Corio's standard non-disclosure agreement, for the sole purpose of verifying the amounts payable to Changepoint under this Agreement. Such inspections may be made no more than once each calendar year, at reasonable times and upon reasonable notice. Changepoint shall bear all costs and expenses of such inspection. If any such inspection discloses a shortfall or an overpayment, the appropriate party shall promptly pay the amount of such shortfall or refund such overpayment. In addition, if any such inspection reveals an underpayment of more than five percent (5%) for the period under audit, Corio shall reimburse Changepoint for the reasonable cost of the examination.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.4 AUDIT RIGHTS. Corio shall keep true and accurate books of accounts and records for determining the amounts payable to Changepoint under this Agreement. Such books and records shall be kept for at least one (1) year following the end of the calendar month to which they pertain, and shall be open for inspection by an internal auditor appointed by Changepoint, and without any non-disclosure agreement, for any purpose Changepoint deems necessary. Such inspections may be made up to three times each calendar year, at any time and without any prior notice. Corio shall bear all costs and expenses of such inspection. If any such inspection discloses a shortfall or an overpayment, Changepoint may choose whether or not to address the discrepancy. In addition, if any such inspection reveals any underpayment, Corio shall immediately terminate the Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: Original text stipulates records must be kept for three years and audits by an independent accountant reasonably acceptable to Corio, limited to once per year. The modified text requires record retention for only one year, audits by an internal auditor without a non-disclosure agreement, allows for three audits per year without notice, and shifts audit cost responsibility to Corio. It also gives Changepoint the option to ignore any discrepancies that may arise during the audit, and gives them the power to immediately terminate the Agreement with any underpayment. These changes create a contradiction in audit procedures and obligations.
